info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:25AM CDT until May 07 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HANCOCK...SOUTHEASTERN HENDERSON...SOUTHWESTERN WARREN AND NORTHWESTERN MCDONOUGH COUNTIES... At 225 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Blandinsville, or 12 miles northwest of Macomb, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Sciota around 235 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Macomb, Good Hope, Western Illinois University, Spring Lake, Swan Creek, McDonough County 4-H Grounds, Macomb Municipal Airport and Scottsburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
